strategy: Experiment with different versions of gradient boosting algorithms such as XGBoost or LightGBM to see if they can improve upon the current baseline.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from xgboost import XGBRegressor

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Handle missing values
train_df.fillna(train_df.mean(), inplace=True)
test_df.fillna(test_df.mean(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
train_df = pd.get_dummies(train_df)
test_df = pd.get_dummies(test_df)

# Split training data into features and target
X = train_df.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y = train_df['SalePrice']

# Standardize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X)
test_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df.drop(columns='Id'))

# Initialize and train XGBoost regressor
xgb_regressor = XGBRegressor(n_estimators=100, learning_rate=0.1, max_depth=5)
xgb_regressor.fit(X_scaled, y)

# Predict on test data
predictions = xgb_regressor.predict(test_scaled)

# Prepare submission dataframe
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_df['Id'],
    'SalePrice': predictions
})

# Save submission
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from xgboost import XGBRegressor

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop columns with non-numerical values
train_df = train_df.select_dtypes(include=[float, int])
test_df = test_df.select_dtypes(include=[float, int])

# Handle missing values
train_df.fillna(train_df.mean(), inplace=True)
test_df.fillna(test_df.mean(), inplace=True)

# Split training data into features and target
X = train_df.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y = train_df['SalePrice']

# Standardize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X)
test_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df.drop(columns='Id'))

# Initialize and train XGBoost regressor
xgb_regressor = XGBRegressor(n_estimators=100, learning_rate=0.1, max_depth=5)
xgb_regressor.fit(X_scaled, y)

# Predict on test data
predictions = xgb_regressor.predict(test_scaled)

# Prepare submission dataframe
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_df['Id'],
    'SalePrice': predictions
})

# Save submission
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
